(cont'd)

"... If the evidence appears to him to allow several different interpretations at that time, he will carry each one of those in his mind, and as new evidence comes along, he will submit each new item of evidence to each of the possible interpretations, until a definitive decision can be made. That is my naive definition of a scientist. I may have reduced the number of those whom you think of as scientists very considerably by that definition. In fact, I may have reduced it to a null class."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Thomas Gold Defines Scientist - Part 2
